metadata.title: CVE-2017-6350 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible
metadata.description:
An integer overflow at an unserialize_uep memory allocation site wouldoccur for vim before patch 8.0.0378, if it does not properly validatevalues for tree length when reading a corrupted undo file, which may leadto resultant buffer overflows.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6350` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:8.0.1144-1ubuntu1
vim-athena - 2:8.0.1144-1ubuntu1
vim-common - 2:8.0.1144-1ubuntu1
vim-gnome - 2:8.0.1144-1ubuntu1
vim-gtk - 2:8.0.1144-1ubuntu1
vim-gtk3 - 2:8.0.1144-1ubuntu1
vim-gui-common - 2:8.0.1144-1ubuntu1
vim-nox - 2:8.0.1144-1ubuntu1
vim-runtime - 2:8.0.1144-1ubuntu1
vim-tiny - 2:8.0.1144-1ubuntu1
xxd - 2:8.0.1144-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vim package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:8.0.1144-1ubuntu1').
